data.title: A Movie Night under the Stars for the Sweetest 6 Year Old • Beijos Events
data.meta_description: What’s better than getting your girlfriends together for a movie night?! Well this notion still holds even for a 6 year old! Everly was turning 6 and wanted a movie party with her best friends, along with popcorn, adorable desserts,...
data.text:
What’s better than getting your girlfriends together for a movie night?! Well this notion still holds even for a 6 year old! Everly was turning 6 and wanted a movie party with her best friends, along with popcorn, adorable desserts, a fun art project and more! We had the best time putting this party together for her and it looks like her and her friends enjoyed themselves too. It was a chilly Fall evening in LA (didn’t know that was possible, ha!) but they still managed to have so much fun!! We have all the details for you to see as usual! Check out this adorable party captured by Le Vie Photography below!

Guests were greeted by the most adorable welcome sign by Poppy Jack Shop. Love all of the movie details and letting guests know what would be showing that night – The Paw Patrol Movie! So fun!

The party was mostly outside in their front and backyards. This house looks like the perfect place to throw a party! And the perfect place for some gorgeous balloons by The Pop Shop! She knows how to make any space even more special!

The kid’s table was set and looking cute as ever! We used Everly’s favorite colors on the table with plates and cups from Oh Happy Day along with the sweetest unicorn napkins from Daydream Society. Of course I added my favorite Sophistiplate flatware! For rentals we had our besties Sweet Salvage Rentals bring an adorable kid’s table and lavender chairs. Then Third & Park added in her absolutely gorgeous floral arrangements and Poppy Jack Shop added tickets at each place setting and our table was complete. Pure cuteness!!!

For a fun activity the kids did an art project with our friends from Camp Lila! Give me all the pretty pastel colors and all of the sparkle! Love these masterpieces!!

Desserts by the amazing Sheila Mae were a must! It isn’t a birthday party without them! I can’t get enough of that cake!! Simply stunning!

Goodie bags are always a fun treat as well! Everly’s mom Sandra threw these together for all of her little friends.

Time for cake!!!!

Our movie set up was nice and cozy! Sweet Salvage Rentals brought out all the cozy pillows, rugs, and blankets for our guests! Along with cute rattan tables to place food or drinks on. And you know The Pop Shop had to deck out the movie screen too!!!

A mush have with any movie is POPCORN!! The Jolly Sheep was there to serve up fresh popped PINK popcorn! Love that!! It was the perfect way to celebrate and end the night with a movie!

These girls are living the life!!

The happy birthday girl!

Such a fun night! Thanks for having us Everly!!

xx

Jacquelyn
